    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(GLHandle handle)
        Description copied from interface: GLRenderable
        Called during initialization and/or recreation of the current rendering environment. This method will be called as soon as a GLRenderControl has added the GLRenderable to its rendering queue.
        Specified by:
        init in interface GLRenderable

      • dispose

        public void dispose(GLHandle handle)
        Description copied from interface: GLRenderable
        Called when the current GL rendering context is being destroyed. GLRenderable implementations should release any resources held both in and out of the OpenGL system.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface GLRenderable

      • render

        public void render(GLHandle handle,
          float interpolation)
        Description copied from interface: GLRenderable
        Called on each frame by the rendering engine. The receiving GLRenderable can use the GLHandle to draw to the GL context.
        Specified by:
        render in interface GLRenderable

      • update

        public void update(long nanoTimeNow,
          long nanoTimeLast)
        Description copied from interface: GLRenderable
        Called on each tick of the game loop. This method is where logic and position updates should take place.
        Specified by:
        update in interface GLRenderable
        Specified by:
        update in interface RenderableSpi
        Parameters:
        nanoTimeNow - the fixed nano time at the start of the update cycle
        nanoTimeLast - the fixed nano time of the last update

      • resize

        public void resize(GLHandle handle,
          int wt,
          int ht)
        Description copied from interface: GLRenderable
        Called when the OpenGL context invoking the GLRenderable has been resized, allowing the GLRenderable object to perform necessary scaling. This method will be called after the GLRenderable.init(GLHandle) method if and only if the GLRenderControl is being displayed in a valid window upon the GLRenderable being added to a rendering queue.
        Specified by:
        resize in interface GLRenderable
        wt - the total width of the current rendering context in screen space
        ht - the total height of the current rendering context in screen space
